title: Detection and enumeration of Lak megaphages in microbiome samples by endpoint and quantitative PCR

DNA extraction from microbiome samples
Timing: 1 h
Validated procedure for DNA extraction using PowerFecal Pro DNA kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) on a range of microbiome samples, including feces/solid digesta, mucosal tissues and fluid digesta. Follow manufacturer instructions with adaptations as below:
Lysis.
Mix solid samples in collection tubes with a sterile spatula.
Place approximately 0.25 g of solid sample in a bead tube with 800 μL lysis buffer.
For liquid samples, use 200 μL of sample with 600 μL lysis buffer.
Heat tubes at 65°C for 10 min, using a water bath or heat block.
Note: Heating will aid disassembly of the phage capsid and the release of genetic material.
Using a vortex adapter, vortex tubes for 10 min at maximum speed.
Inhibitor removal and washing (as specified in manufacturer instructions)
Elution.
Use 60 μL of elution buffer and incubate spin column at room temperature (20°C–22°C) for 10 min.
. Centrifuge at 13,000 ×g for 1 min.
. Once eluted, pass the same 60 μL eluate back through the same spin column (without incubation) and repeat centrifugation.
Measure DNA concentration by UV spectrophotometry.
Store DNA at −20°C until analysis.
RECOMMENDED: Use of filter tips when processing microbiome samples.
Amplification of Lak phage structural protein-coding genes by PCR
Timing: 1 h 30 min

Amplification of Lak phage major capsid protein (MCP), portal vertex protein (PVP) and tail sheath monomer (TSM) gene fragments can be used for detection of Lak phages in biological samples. These signature genes were selected from metagenomic datasets, due to their specificity and conservation across Lak phage genomes. The general screening primers are specific to Lak phages found in humans, primates, pigs and most other animals. An additional set was designed to detect the divergent ∼660 kbp variant discovered in a racehorse microbiome (Crisci et al., 2021[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2]). Endpoint analysis of PCR products
Timing: 2 h
Presence of Lak phage in microbiome DNA can be visualized using agarose gel electrophoresis.
Purified PCR products can be sequenced for confirmation and comparison. We recommend using either QIAquick PCR purification or gel extraction kits (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) prior to sequencing. To maximise yield, follow manufacturer instructions with adaptations as below:
Use 30 μL of elution buffer and incubate spin column at room temperature for 10 min.
Centrifuge at 13,000 ×g for 1 min.
Once eluted, pass the same 30 μL eluate back through the same spin column (without incubation) and repeat centrifugation.

Measure DNA concentration by UV spectrophotometry.
Critical: PCR purification of Lak MCP gene amplicons is a prerequisite in generating standards for the following qPCR assay.
qPCR quantification of Lak phage major capsid protein-coding gene
This protocol has been validated for use with the QuantiNova SYBR Green PCR kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany), and PikoRealTM real-time PCR system (Thermo Fisher Scientific, MA, USA) (Crisci et al., 2021[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2]). However, the following procedure can be adapted for any SYBR green-based qPCR kit and compatible instrument. As Lak phage genomes are generally AT-rich, the MCP gene was selected due to its conservation and higher GC content (∼41%) than other genes, which provides better thermal stability in qPCR reactions.
Critical: The use of PCR product as qPCR standard is expected to yield an efficiency over 100% (Crisci et al., 2021[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2]). Efficiencies between 90 and 110% are considered acceptable for quantification. It is advisable to calculate amplification efficiencies using standards and primers prior to qPCR quantification.
e.g. (−1+10−1/slope) × 100
Prepare standards for qPCR
Timing: 30 min
Lak phage MCP gene amplicons (MCP: LakMC581-F/LakMC1053-R and MCP_660: LakHMC185-F/LakHMC984-R) are used as qPCR standards. The qPCR target regions are within the regions amplified by the endpoint PCR primers (Table 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl1]). Once a PCR product is obtained, prepare qPCR standards as follows.
Prepare 9 × 1:10 serial dilutions of PCR amplicon (starting at 5 ng).
In the first tube, adjust Lak major capsid PCR product to 5 ng/μL using nuclease-free water or 1× template dilution buffer.
Then, add 2 μL from the first tube to 18 μL nuclease-free water or 1× template dilution buffer, mix by pipetting up and down, and discard the tip.
